newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada Q2 GDP price deflator rises.
newsitem.headline: Canada Q2 GDP price deflator rises.

text.p: Canada's implicit price index for calculation of gross domestic product at market prices rose 0.5 percent in the second quarter to 128.5 (base 1986) after a 0.2 percent fall in the first quarter, Statistics Canada said on Friday.
Economists surveyed by Reuters had forecast a rise of 0.2 percent in the first quarter.
A Reuters survey of economists had forecast a 0.7 percent rise in the second quarter after the 0.3 percent rise/fall in the previous quarter.
The agency said Canada's trade surplus reached an 11-year high but businesses undertook substantial inventory liquidation.
"The demand for housing also contributed to the overall second-quarter growth as the recovery that began in the first quarter of the year gained momentum," it said.
